word_mean: 肋〔骨〕：成对的弹性骨弓中的任何一根，两侧各12根，由胸椎伸向躯干腹侧的中线，形成胸廓的大部分。上部7对肋骨(真肋)在腹侧与胸骨相连接，而下部5对肋骨(假肋)则非。总称costae 〔NA〕

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English rib, ribb (noun), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch rib(be) and German Rippe. Sense 1 of the verb dates from the mid 16th cent.; the sense 'tease' was originally a US slang usage meaning to 'fool, dupe' (1930s)

entry.def: Your ribs are the 12 pairs of curved bones that surround your chest.

example.ex: Her heart was thumping against her ribs...
example.tran: 她的心脏紧抵着肋骨砰砰跳动。

example.ex: My face was covered with bruises and I had a broken rib.
example.tran: 我的脸上全是瘀伤，肋骨还断了一根。

entry.def: A rib of meat such as beef or pork is a piece that has been cut to include one of the animal's ribs.
Rib is a method of knitting that makes a raised pattern of parallel lines. You use rib, for example, round the edge of sweaters so that the material can stretch without losing its shape.
If you rib someone about something, you tease them about it in a friendly way.

example.ex: The guys in my local pub used to rib me about drinking 'girly' drinks.
example.tran: 我家当地酒馆里的人以前总是取笑我喝“女人”饮料。

means.word_mean: 1. support resembling the rib of an animal
2. any of the 12 pairs of curved arches of bone extending from the spine to or toward the sternum in humans (and similar bones in most vertebrates)
3. cut of meat including one or more ribs
5. a riblike supporting or strengthening part of an animal or plant
6. a projecting molding on the underside of a vault or ceiling; may be ornamental or structural
